metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11099 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The header::add_INFO_descriptor function in header.cpp in VCFtools 0.1.15 allows remote attackers to cause information disclosure (heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted vcf file. It was discovered that VCFtools improperly handled certain input. If a user was tricked into opening a crafted input file, VCFtools could be made to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vcftools - 0.1.16-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vcftools package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.1.16-1').
